website_summaries.verdict: Powerful suction helps this pool cleaner get at debris in all corners of a pool. Made specifically for in-ground pools.
pros: Cleans really well and is easy to use
It gets stuck a lot less than other models and runs quietly
It also happens to be priced quite fairly
cons: Instruction manual is useless and those with larger pools may need to add an extra hose section to reach all areas

website_summaries.verdict: A good alternative to wheeled models that can damage liners. Handles larger debris (leaves, pebbles) with relative ease. We recommend pool owners use both automatic and manual vacuuming for best results.
pros: Works equally well with high- and low-pressure pumps
36 fins improve adhesion to pool floors, steps, walls
Won't leave scuff marks on cleaned surfaces
cons: Assembly and operation instructions could be clearer
Sometimes needs guidance into shallower parts of pool
Tends to perform a figure-8 cleaning pattern without assistance

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Great! (With Straight Hoses)
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Great Construction. Simple. Here is the VERY IMPORTANT trick I have learned about it cleaning the WHOLE pool though. KEEP YOUR HOSES STRAIGHT WHILE IN STORAGE!! As soon as you get those things bent all bets are off. Bent hoses cause it to loop on itself and only clean a small portion, usually just the deep end. However, if you buy a hose hanger, like HoseHanger Pro it will straighten back out, or just lay them flat out in the sun. Even bent hose can be made straight again and when they are the system cleans the deep and the shallow ends and works great!
customer_reviews.author: jzumbrun

customer_reviews.title: He said yeah so I asked what a good one is and what they cost these days
customer_reviews.text: i remember a wealthier family having an auto pool vacuum of a different manufacturer when I was a kid so I asked our pool man if they still existed. He said yeah so I asked what a good one is and what they cost these days. He said i should get one with the leaf basket skimmer attachment. I was skeptical and it was such a screaming deal that I bought this one on amazon figuring if I can't add the leaf skimmer acessory i'll just return it. Well it works great and I found out ofcourse the leaf skimmer can be purchased and added on afterwards for around $50 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Another Bloke

customer_reviews.title: A Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this cleaner, based on the high ratings other people gave it. However, this thing has failed miserably in cleaning my pool, a 16x34 sports pool. It never works its way to the shallow corners of the pool, areas that really need cleaning. Most of the time, the cleaner seats itself right over the main drain (even when the main drain is turned off). I tried a number of things to improve the cleaner's performance, but no improvement. A total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: I.G. Man

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: We have had a pool in each of three homes over the past 30 yrs. They ranged from Ohio to FL and from 42,000 gallons to 9700 gals. In its first month, the Baracuda is as good as any cleaner we have ever had. I like that it has so few moving parts and they are easily & inexpensively replaced. It does a beautiful job of cleaning walls and floors but don’t expect it to do stairs unless they are very broad. Install will be uncomplicated as long as you observe the directions completely. Note that this cleaner does not work well under a pool cover as the hose is designed to float. Research your needs before flashing the cash
customer_reviews.author: forepaughs

customer_reviews.title: Some recommendations in instructions did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: When installing it make sure to use the flow meter to measure suction from the pool wall or skimmer and you achieve a 3 on the measurement otherwise the suction may cause the unit to go above the water line or not climb the walls of the pool. They recommended that you use 2 lengths of hose longer that the longest stretch from the unit installs into the pool to the furthes3e point of the pool. When I did that it kept getting hung up in the corner where the steps came down into the pool. I removed the two extra lengths and it works great - never hangs up and the pool has never been so clean.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Valente

customer_reviews.title: Functions well, dependable, durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Baracuda in about 37 years. The last one functioned for better than 15 years in South Florida with only replacement of the soft rubber parts every few years. When I received the new Baracuda, I took the soft rubber parts off the old one a spares for the new one. Considering the effects of Chlorine and UV, this design is really hard to beat. Why waste your money on junk that will only last for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Boca Ron

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear and inviting!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and his wife as a house warming gift. They simply love it! It does ALL the work and leaves the pool crystal clear and very inviting! We live in south Florida where a dip in a nice clean refreshing pool is a daily activity- especially if you have little ones. This pool cleaner is an excellent value for the money and I would definitely recommend it, and I would by it again! I also purchased a 3 year extended warranty for $40- The warranty explicitly explains that “if they cannot fix the unit they will replace it with a new one.” - not too bad for $40!! 😎
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O’Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Works great and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Zodiac we have owned and we love it. It does a great job on keeping our pool clean, goes right up the sides like nothing. Definitely worth trying and not outrageously expensive like some other pool cleaners out there.
customer_reviews.author: EKD71

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to any pool owner, in-ground or out.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. It performs as well as the Polaris at a MUCH more affordable price. Very impressed. Not as complicated nor in need of addtional parts (bag, weights, special pool pump inlets, etc.). It does require a little more attention getting in-and-out of pool. Also, if you have acorn dropping trees (oak) you will need to get them out of the pool first, as they are hard and will not pass the throat, stopping the pulse cleaning action and require getting the shell out with your finger. If you have a larger pool you will definitely need to purchase extra hose segments. I highly recommend purchasing the Zodiac Cyclonic Leaf Catcher CLC500.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: This is the Vaccuum to Own
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good vacuum for over a year because I wanted something good but I didn't want to spend $500 on one of those robotic looking units with wheels. Just like the other reviews said the baby climbs the walls and has little trouble sucking up anything. The rain has been heavy here and chlorine hasn't been able to stop all of the algae but this vacuum has been working overtime to get the green out. The fact that it also comes with a brand new hose is amazing. That much hose would cost me $100 by itself at the local pool store.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Stamper

customer_reviews.title: First one lasted ten years!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. It’s only the second one in ten years. Yes I had to replace a part here and there down thru the years but at minimal cost. I only bought a new one because the old one lost its suppleness and got all chalky. It’s a real Zodiac OEM and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Flenn

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Barracuda since moving into my house. While I think they should last longer, that is really on my for leaving in the pool during the day in the hot Arizona sun. With this purchase, I take it out when not in use. I have a traditional plaster pool, with a deep end. The Barracuda hits all the spots, does not get stuck on stairs, and goes up walls. Every time I need a new one I look at other models and keep going back to what works.
customer_reviews.author: A discerning reader

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: We are pleasantly surprised, exceeds our expectations. It was getting stuck in two corners by stairs until I adjusted the pool valves to run the pressure a little higher than they recommend, and played with the weight position, finally removed it completely, now it never gets stuck. Goes up the walls very well. Our pool has never looked better. Does a much better job than our previous wheel-driven one that needed to have moving parts replaced periodically.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sollecito

customer_reviews.title: its OK
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are terrible, and you would thinks its easy to assemble but if you have never done one, its confusing, Getting it to work is also not easy sometimes we have to fiddle with it or let it suck in some air to get it to work. Should shake when its working. I had to watch videos from pool companies to figure it out, the Zodiac wasn't much help. It works OK though I have never seen it go up the sides an it gets stuck on the ladder
customer_reviews.author: Berryman

customer_reviews.title: Worthless POS ,doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Worthless gargabe DO NOT BUY Great cleaner if you want something that cleans the same 10% of your pool over and over and over again and leaves the other 90% filthy dirty Adjusted the hose length to every possible length ,adjusted the flow to every possible setting ,the POS still does the same useless pattern every single time even if I nudge it to try and make it take a new path it just immediately goes back to the exact same trajectory within a few seconds of moving it Does not work at all save you money and you time and just a buy something else
customer_reviews.author: steven r.

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed how well this thing works. Climbs walls straight up and the bottom of our in ground vinyl liner pool that is 9 feet deep. Had a Hayward that was worthless and needed replacement parts all the time and it never cleaned the walls. Tip: follow instructions and place connection in skimmer closest to pump and not the one closet to the main entry stairs of pool. This will help keep it from getting stuck in that area.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Well Done.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Zodiac Baracuda G3 for 10 years. There have been times when I have needed to replace various parts and have most recently replaced the entire system. Living in AZ, we never shut down our pool so the system runs every single day. With the exception of extremely windy weather when leaves and dust inundate the pool, this system works very, very well. As long as you pay attention to the system and replace parts as needed, which is not often, I highly recommend the Baracuda.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for small debris - Not for Acorns
customer_reviews.text: In the spring the G3 worked great with all the fine pollen dust on the bottom of my pull. Now that the fall is here it is working fine, with one exception, Acorns. The G3 is able to pick up smaller acorns, but the larger one get stuck in the diaphragm. I have to grab the cleaner off the bottom and use a dowel to push the acorn through the diaphragm. Since I have a large oak tree over my pool this is a fatal flaw for me. In the spring I will be selling my G3 and getting a different cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Needs super vision
customer_reviews.text: At first it was frustrating, but it does clean well. You do have to kinda have to babysit it. I just start it at the farthest pint. An hour later go check on it. Pull it back to farthest point. I say it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: teena m.

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is to assemble and to use. I attach it to the dedicated port below my skimmer basket and am able to have the skimmer work also. It took some experimenting to get the proper balance of suction and weight, etc. But it works beautifully. I do have to readjust the returns periodically to control the movements of the Baracuda so that it covers the entire pool and I still need to manually brush or vacuum certain spots. But I am really pleased and no longer have to vacuum manually.
customer_reviews.author: dr.j

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck within minutes
customer_reviews.text: I think I might as well have purchased the tools to vacuum the pool manually rather than this thing. It can't go for more than a few minutes without finding its way back to the steps where it is permanently stuck. If a person doesn't watch it and rescue it over and over, it is essentially worthless. I have played with weights and made the hose longer and shorter to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Mastiff

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. I did my homework and read the reviews before purchasing, however it keeps getting stuck at the main drain. We have tried all different pressures for the vacuum but once it gets near the drain, it stops right there. At lower pressures, it won't adhere to the bottom to do its job. It's very frustrating since we have to go out and turn it off, then move it across the pool, start it again, only to have it get stuck on the main drain again. Very frustrating!!!!!!! Definitely would not buy this product again!! Want to return this and purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: MrsSlip

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This Barracuda Cleans our pool so good. There was a Barracuda at this home when we bought it but it was worn out and did not work. We bought a new diaphragm for the old one without realizing that the cleaning foot was worn out. Now we have this new one and spare parts from the old one if needed, but the new one works exceptionally well! I recommend this to anyone! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Brynn Cee

customer_reviews.title: Love Our Baracuda!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to make it easier for him to clean the pool. He used to spend hours cleaning the pool and now all he has to do is connect all the parts and let "Barry" clean the pool. We have a free form pool and this Zodiac Baracuda does a fantastic job. It goes up the wall, gets the ledges around the pool and does a great job on the steps. I would HIGHLY recommend this pool cleaner if you want to make pool cleaning a piece of cake!
customer_reviews.author: Katydid

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the G3 purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This Baracuda G3 replaces my older G3, which I've had for several years. There are a number of pool vacuums around that are more expensive and claim to provide better cleaning action. These are usually more complicated with additional moving parts that will fail and have to be replaced as the unit ages. The G3 essentially has one moving part...the diaphram, located in the vacuum head. It's low cost and easy to change. The price and delivery from SaveMoreOnPoolSupplies were excellent. The same unit from a pool store would have cost me over $300.00. Very happy with the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Mister T

customer_reviews.title: Instructions written for someone who knows how to install or use it.
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for current device. Instructions do not include all parts and leave you to figure it out. Should be able to take anyone and they can install with the included instructions with minimal trouble. If someone thinks instructions are so simple that they are insulting they should just ignore them. Little pricey but would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: beauchamp43

customer_reviews.title: 7.5 years and keep going
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Baracuda for 7.5 years and still going strong. I had to replace some parts about 3 years ago, but the main body structure is still good. I replaced the inner suction soft tube as a rock tore part of it. Also the flap blue outer disk and the yellow shoe part that hold the blue flap, all because they worn out over time. Buying replacement parts is very cheap. The hose is still good, but I broke 2 3 months ago because I pulled too hard to separate them.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi's Friends

customer_reviews.title: Clean Pool
customer_reviews.text: Use on my inground vinyl pool. Cleans very well and gets the whole pool. Had another G3 that finally gave up its ghost after many years work in a non-saltwater pool. Changed to saltwater and got new G3. Very happy with it and vendor got it to me a day earlier than predicted. Very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: We tried to get this thing to work for months, and it kust wont. It doesnt move at all. Or if it does jts for about 30 seconds. Either gets stuck on something, loses suction, or who knows what. I have spent hours on end trying to get this thing to work. Its been in storage for about 1.5 years and i got it out today to give it another shot. Nope. Messed with it for 2 hours. Read the user manual and everything. Ive had our pool guy show me how to adjust the suction, nothing seems to matter. Finally broke down and got an electric dolphin vacuum and the difference is insane!
customer_reviews.author: MTR

customer_reviews.title: Great pool cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second barracuda we’ve purchased. The previous on lasted 15 years! We have a fairly small in ground pool about 14x26. We considered a more expensive pool cleaner but were so happy with the old one we just replaced it. The new one does an even better job of keeping the pool clean. We haven’t manually vacuumed in years! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Weak movement, always stuck at far/deep end, exhausting solutions
customer_reviews.text: I exhausted options to make the barracuda not stuck somewhere in the far (deep) side. I already tried: (1) increase/decrease suction around the recommended level 3. (2) shorten/lengthen the hose length around the recommendation length. (3) add twister and verify that it do the slow gyration of the hose (4) make sure there are no air leaking along the hose line. I guess the motion is weak due to cold water (50 F) make the diaphragm harder to contract and expand. I will retry when temperature reach 60 F during spring.
customer_reviews.author: Nam Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Greatest addition to our pool!
customer_reviews.text: Our inground pool is surrounded by oak trees and has no cage so keeping our pool clean is a full time job. We had tried other more expensive wheeled pool cleaners but they would always flip over due to the shape of our pool walls or get stuck in corners. This product soled both problems. Within a day of running the bottom of our pool is spotless with not even a grain of sand present. Simple to set up and practically maintenance free. We absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: TheNurses

customer_reviews.title: Great pool vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd of these vacuums that I have had over the course of 15 years. Having to replace it every 5 years sounds like a lot, but considering the price, it's really not bad. I love that the only part that can "break" is the diaphragm, which is very easily replaced. I continue to purchase this vacuum because of how well it works and its simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Good cleaner
customer_reviews.text: My mother in law bought this. I was looking for a robot cleaner instead of something so simple. Glad we got this honestly. It works flawlessly to clean the entire pool except for the stairs and sunstep which I am completely fine with. Takes a little patience to get the jets right to push it where it needs to go consistently but once those are adjusted correctly you never have to touch them again. Keeps my pool looking clean and awesome and when a part eventually breaks replacements are cheap and readily available. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Marrier

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Our expensive Hayward pool cleaner of 7 years finally gave out. I just had surgery and we have a lot of medical bills and didn't have $400+ to replace it so we were looking for a less expensive option. This was the right price and had great reviews. We have had it running for a week now and the pool looks great. The only thing that surprised me is the "pulse" motion it uses to clean so the hose bops up and down. At first we thought something was wrong but googled it and found it was normal. I'll update if anything happens but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Heather P.

customer_reviews.title: So far it sucks but not where it should
customer_reviews.text: Assembled per the directions that came with it. Out it in the water and it goes to one corner and hides. My wife is pissed, that doesn't make me happy. She's back to vacuuming by hand. I went to the website and downloaded the manual there. Much more detail in the instructions. will try to set it up again using those directions. The old one worked great, it just fell apart. This one so far not so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: As pictures show my pool was pretty dirty. This cleaned her right up. It goes up walls & really left nothing behind. I gave 2 stars on assembly due to pretty poor instructions. However, I figured it out & I am not too handy. That’s the 1 thing I would suggest for company to give better instructions. I am happy with the product & cleaning it provide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is our third Baracuda - our previous two lasted 14 years between them!
customer_reviews.text: This is our third Baracuda - our previous two lasted 14 years between them and they were in the pool 24/7 in the hot Florida sun and weather. Easy to use and works extremely well on our inground pool. When the footpad or diaphragm wears out (after YEARS of use), they are easy to replace and inexpensive compared to parts for other pool cleaners. When it is set up correctly, this thing even gets the top of the steps, in the corners, and on the walls. I hope the Baracuda is still available the next time we need a new pool cleaner in 7 or 8 years!
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many pool cleaners but this is the best. I just snapped it together, hooked it up to the skimmer connection, and it worked. I did not need to make any adjustments to it. Six months later and I still haven't had to pay any attention to it. Like any pool vacuum, some parts will wear out in the future, but parts are readily available. When this one dies, I will replace it with another.
customer_reviews.author: F. Morris

customer_reviews.title: This replaced my original unit that finally let go of ...
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my original unit that finally let go of all its spare hoses. I have a small pool that only uses about 8 to fully clean it, whereas these units ship with 12 hoses in the box. The sunlight is particularly strong here in Phoenix AZ, and nothing can survive long. Through changing the internal diaphrams with inexpensive replacement parts, the bottom ring and other pieces we finally found value in replacing the whole unit over buying individual sections of the replacement hose. I expect this would last longer than 8 years in AZ and still give it 5 stars for surviving that long!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works great, simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple and effective solution for a pool cleaner. I had to add an extra section of hose because my pool is large. I followed the instructions with regards to setting the hose length which are easy to follow. The unit is a cost effective, simple solution for a pool robot. Virtually no moving parts make it reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product, check it out
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for about 3 weeks but do far I'm very happy with it. It doesn't like to climb stairs ( neither do i.) However, does climb the walls well, & really helps to keep that green fungi at Bay. Really cleans the pool floor and quite quickly. I do not recommend this item &;if it holds up well it's a be good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Hike

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Initially purchased many years ago, bought a few replacement parts over the years but bought another new one to replace the original. This is a great pool cleaner. It cleans the debris on the bottom and whatever maybe on the sides. Although the cleaner does wear down in its' cleaning power over the years and needs a few replacement (wearable) parts, it is still a fantastic pool cleaner. I guess the simplicity is the major appeal to me - it just works well at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: D R

customer_reviews.title: Hangs Up on Steps
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an identical unit which just "aged out" at seven years. Probably owing to better suction performance with the replacement, it constantly hangs up in the curved corner between the side of the pool and the bottom step to the "tanning ledge." Occasionally, it frees itself, but I usually just give it a tug and send it on its way to other areas of the pool. Wish it didn't do this, but not a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: Barb C

customer_reviews.title: nice unit, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years now. They last well and keep the pool clean. This vendor sent me a great product and the shipping time and arrival condition was excellent. The price was very competitive. I would purchase this product from this vendor again. Oh, installation was fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Q.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this pool vacuum for our inground, oval shaped pool. I will say, I have to leave it running for several hours for it to really clean the pool but since it’s running off the pump/filter (which I run 24/7 since our pool season is only 3-4 months long) it’s not really costing me anymore to run. Sometimes I have to use the long pole of the debris scooper to push the head of the vacuum down to achieve suction which is a little irritating but overall for the price and easy of use, I’m happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: zodiac g3 works
customer_reviews.text: expensive item...however I purchased all the least expensive products out there. Maybe the cheapest blades or poory constructed. I don't know. This one works period don't waste your money or time like me. I have box of these crawling hopping items. This G3 actually works always without fidgeting
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Corner

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I’ve had they work pretty good when you figure out how to keep it from getting stuck in a corner. Living in Florida the sun really beats up the plastic. Overall pretty good and better than having to do it manually.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Cleaner, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This pool cleaner has worked great. We had a more expensive unit from the original install of the pool (Hayward?), although is worked well the past few years were less than stellar. I read a lot of reviews for this unit and decided to give it a try. We have been very pleased with it, and find that it cleans much better and covered more surfaces than the old unit. This things crawls the walls and steps, which our old unit did not. We are impressed!

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Sweep
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a replacement for a similar unit that I had used for over 5 years. The new baracuda delivers the same cleaning power as my previous unit with a much better performance. Easy to assemble, install and up and running in a matter of minutes. Cleans the entire pool without any dead spots and removes hard to get leaves, palm blooms, etc. Great unit for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Worry, Bee Happy

customer_reviews.title: Power and simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older model of Barracuda that had lasted many years (came with house at purchase, was worn then, 4 years ago). We liked the cleaning power and simplicity of the pool vacuum for our vintage in-ground pool. The new Barracuda is even better! Vacuums the lower steps, goes up the sides to almost the water line (will actually try to climb out if the suction is not adjusted down), and runs all day with no strain on our 1 hp pump.
customer_reviews.author: poetrynmotion

customer_reviews.title: Best pool cleaner I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This unit climbs the walls of my pool very nicely. I have yet to hear it 'suck wind' as some of my other pool cleaners have done. It cleans a very wide swath. I have a deep pool, and it's pain to brush the bottom. This gadget makes brushing unnecessary...at least up till now. I'd recommend this to anyone versus a mechanical cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, easy set up and maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: Even though there are no moving parts, things wear out. This is my 3rd G3; they seem to last about 5 years or so. I'm in AZ, so heavy use and very warm water -- 80+ 6 months of the year. The internal diaphragm is the piece you'll replace most. Great value, and not much that can go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this G3 as a replacement for the last one that lasted almost 10 years. Easy to use . Sometimes I have to brush the shallow end into the deeper, but that is OK. I don't need to manually vacuum anything, just brush. Price is high, but I'm hoping it lasts as long as the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Streeter

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Been using barracuda for ages. You can't go wrong using it on my above ground. Rarely a leaf left behind. Recommend using the suction gauge that is provided it will allow the diaphragm to last the longest and keeps it from knocking (making noise). Otherwise it's silent, don't waste money on the other vacs, I had a cheapy before it was loud. Highly recommend, oh and the replacement parts are cheap. My father had a barracuda that's ten years old!! Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Morris

customer_reviews.title: A great product.....
customer_reviews.text: I'm very please with this product. I have a lot of trees in my back yard, so debris in my pool is always a problem. I used to have a robotic dolphin pool cleaner, but I got tired of having to lug that thing in and out of the pool each time I wanted to clean it which was daily. This item just hooks into your skimmer intake, and runs as long as you have your pool pump is running, I just have to clean out the pool pump basket from all of the debris this item picks up, which is easy to do. My pool is spotless now, I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: DFWJTubbs1

customer_reviews.title: Like most you have to watch them
customer_reviews.text: So far I like the vacuum, easy to setup, I used some of my other hose because I have a Olympic size pool, you do have to baby sit a little but I had to do that to my creepy crawler that broke also, I payed 350 for that and it lasted only 3 months, had so much suction that when I drove in it ripped apart...well this one is hundred bux cheaper and comes with better attachments, I by passed using the pressure regulator because I have no patients...had it up and running in 25minutes
customer_reviews.author: Brad A. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: I envy those people who say they have it working properly.
customer_reviews.text: Hours and days and weeks spent in frustrating attempts to make this thing work properly. Neither I or the nice barracuda tech rep who tried to help over the phone could get it right. We tried every possible combination of settings, several different kinds of hoses, various suction port and skimmer adapter combinations, hose weight locations, etc., all to no avail. We could make it work differently, but never got to the point where it covered every surface of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: dimrilldell

customer_reviews.title: Great if your pool has a simple design and not much steps and sharp angles.
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to get the pool jets adjusted for me but not every pool is the same. My pool has lost of sharp lines and stares. Which in my opinion its struggles with, but my pool still stays very clean and the price compared to other solutions is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Romme

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: this vaccuum has no suction, it just stays in 1 spot. had to use the previous owners vacuum application over this waste of money. if i didnt put this thing in the water i would ask for money back
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for a vinyl liner pool.
customer_reviews.text: Had one like this 10-15 years ago for a gunite pool and it worked great! Bought this for a vinyl liner pool and was very disappointed. It kept finding new and interesting ways to get stuck, including in a corner, around a ladder, or just against the wall. Biggest problem was seeing how it scuffed up the vinyl liner in places in less than a week! I returned it and replaced it with a different type. Thanks, Amazon, for your generous return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Paw423

customer_reviews.title: Saves me so much time!  No more tennis elbows!  Works with the cover closed.
customer_reviews.text: We have an inground, 40,000 gallon pool with a deep end. It took a little trial and error to get the G3 working correctly. I had to buy an extra weight and figure out where to place it on the hose. Once we got the flowmeter to read "3" it worked perfectly. We close the pool cover when it's not in use, and the G3 cleans 24 hours a day. I no longer have to brush and manually vacuum the pool, which has been a lifesaver for the tendonitis in both my elbows. We did NOT have to redirect the return lines as the manual recommends. A fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: fauxbot5000

customer_reviews.title: not working
customer_reviews.text: I need help with this product, I put in the suction part and it makes my pump shut off, Have the pool guy try it and not working either, Had pumped serviced and nothing is working when I put it in, I either need help with this product from some one on their end or I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It's just ok
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. But does get stuck in corner at times. Update. After several months of using this. I'm about ready to throw it away. Doesn't cover entire pool well. Seems to repeat patterns. Missing a lot of the bottom of pool. Don't waste your money on this if you used a more expensive unit before hand. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Cheapers best cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest best item I have ever bought. Been working with pool cleaning devices for 40 years, starting with an old Pool Sweep and working up to a robotic model. This was bought as a temp fix when my old robotic cleaner needed a rebuild but now I think it might well be far better. Not sure about durability but so far so good. Had to buy hoses separately and then buy yet another few links. Very important to follow instructions on the hose length and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Post

customer_reviews.title: Stalls out frequently 😑
customer_reviews.text: I’m having similar problems as other consumers with low ratings. This isn’t the pool cleaner for anyone who gets any debris in the pool. It gets stalled and quits moving anytime anything such as a larger leaf or a seed pod is sucked up. We have a cartridge filter and it must be pristine for this to run. The Baracuda just couldn’t handle cleaning our 15000 gallon sport pool.
customer_reviews.author: K. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have a fiberglass pool I would have given a 5 star except my hose is located on the side of the pool between the deep and shallow ends. The hose gets stuck every once in a while, not a big deal I just move it and it is back on its way. I like that it cleans the walls as well, and it moves fast, it has not cleaned the steps I don't think it will. For the cost, as long as it does not break its a great product.
customer_reviews.author: M Maxey

customer_reviews.title: JUST AMAZED
customer_reviews.text: Works great I have used Kreppy Crawlers for 10 years and had to replace them every 5 yrs, I had my doubts that the Barracuda would work 1/2 as good and when the box arrived and I unpacked it and put it together I just knew I would have to send it back but to my surprise when I plugged in in and turned it on it took off and starting cleaning I was amazed at the speed while cleaning and it never got stuck on the drains or steps like the Kreppy Crawler did, I have a mush better pool cleaner for a lot less money
customer_reviews.author: Robert Evans

customer_reviews.title: Baracuda cleans better then me
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Baracuda for my different past pools. We moved to a new house where there is construction all around us. Dirt has been constantly blowing into the bottom. Before this G3, I was vacuuming and brushing 2-3 times a day. Since I installed the G3, the pool has been crystal clear, without me doing a thing. Shipping was faster than expected. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: thevet

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Although this particular unit came highly recommended, I am very disappointed in the performance. The cleaner head wouldn’t move it stayed in one place...I had to go out and move it several times a day and every time it ended up “stuck” back in the same spot. It doesn’t go up the walls at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquie M.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year before it broke.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for about a year and it already broke. The suction valve isn't working anymore. That's a lot of money for not even lasting a year. I previously had the Kreepy Krawly and it lasted 4 years. I'm going back to it.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: WE were in desperate need of this real quick. Shipping was awesome. Came with hoses too, that I wasn't aware of when purchasing . It does not get hung up on sides of pool. But it travels up high. Suction is great. I would highly recommend this product. Well worth the price, no complaints have used it all summer.
customer_reviews.author: carrie

customer_reviews.title: Items missing / no money back
customer_reviews.text: Items were missing, i asked for money back for those items and never received it. Vacuum keeps getting stuck at the stairs, I've tried adding/removing hoses and moved the weight but still no difference, this might be the last time I'll buy this vacuum, I've bought a few of these in the past for all my properties.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyM, FL

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Kept My Old Baracuda
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Zodiac Baracuda in my pool that was working well, but I had to replace the diaphragm every few months. It was getting a little beat up, so I decided to replace it with a new one. Same model, but no matter what I do, it will not vacuum certain areas of the pool floor. Every morning I have to guide the vacuum over the dirty parts of the pool floor. Should have left well enough alone...
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Capurso

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and set up but the cleaning pattern repeats itself and leaves areas of the pool untouched. I resolve this by taking out sections of hose to make it clean in a different pattern. So I am able to get the entire pool clean (16 by 32 rectangle with an 8 ft deep end) with a little extra effort. That is the reason for the 4 star instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have used a number of different pool cleaners but once I found the G3 I have never bought anything else. Diaphragm is the only moving part and is easily replaced. Other cleaners had more moving parts which seemed to constantly be wearing out. Very pleased with the G3.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: OMG I love this thing so much
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks so much. Bought a new house, moved in and used the pool 3x before it turned a sad shade of green :( Bought this fella and hired a pool guy too. Thanks to both elements, the pool is clean and clear and i expend very little effort in making it that way. I also bought a few extra diaphragms to have around since I have heard that they will wear out faster if you have trees around the pool, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Charity C

customer_reviews.title: Has trouble migrating to the shallow end of the pool.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work the middle and deep end but leaves the shallow end alone. The pool is a Viking Mediteranean fiberglass pool with a 5.5 foot deep end. I added extra hose lengths thinking that would help. I can help it along and pull it towards the shallow end but it would be nice if it would do it on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Surma

customer_reviews.title: Great pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, I have had several types of pool cleaners, but the barracuda seems to be the best. In Florida, the pool cleaners work year round and really take a beating. This will be my 4th Barracuda since I get about 4-5 years out of each one. They do a great cleaning job and I will continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but not working as good as previous one
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of these and have been very satisfied. It seems like something has changed or it could be I just haven’t figured out how to adjust with my new filter. I went from a DE filter to a sand filter. I have a separate vacuum line so I don’t need to use the skimmer attachments. I’m having issues with it only doing one side of the deep in of my 8 ft inground pool. I believe in this product (apparently since this is my 3rd one) so will continue to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Landgraf

customer_reviews.title: tried chinese knockoff - ended up going back to zodiac
customer_reviews.text: I did try some cheap chinese knockoffs. they did work great until they didn't. broke after 11 months at the core. zodiac won't last forever either, but a good 5-10 years (with replacing some smaller parts)
customer_reviews.author: Lukas

customer_reviews.title: Great pool cleaner! Buy this and skip that Hayward Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Hayward VFlex that lasted 12 months in a professionally maintained pool. Then it was rebuilt during a Hayward Days event for free (I thought: "How nice!") Then the rebuilt one lasted 11 months and when I inquired I was told "Too bad - buy a new one." So far, this cleaner is just great. It climbs the walls of my gunite pool all the way to the top and has no parts that can wear out - it's basically a diaphragm that sort of operates like a squid/jellyfish. I'm very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works.like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought this years ago!!! Saves so much time and energy. Set it and forget it.....pool is spotless. Set up was a breeze....15 minutes and it was ready for the pool. I have a 25' x 14' fiberglass pool. Plenty of hose for my needs....in fact I didnt use them all. Flow meter tool provided allowed me to set the proper balance between the side return and the skimmer with little effort. Worked almost perfectly from the start. The only problem I experienced was that you need to turn off any other returns that are under water like lower skimmer or it will.lose suction and get stuck when the shark runs over it. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J.

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try
customer_reviews.text: Only a week of use so far and it's great. My mx6 was not doing so great after a couple of years of every day use so i bought this one instead. I will see how it does in the fall with the leaves. One leaf would shut down the mx6 so i'm anxious to see this one work. I like the constant contact with the surface as it moves along the pool. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: ... this almost a month now and it's doing a good job keeping the pool clean
customer_reviews.text: We've had this almost a month now and it's doing a good job keeping the pool clean. We still manually vacuum the pool about once a week and brush the sides every 3 days. It came with more than enough hose for a 16 x 32 in-ground pool. At first it got stuck on top of the steps, removing 2 sections of hose fixed that problem. So far, so good. We like it and would purchase it again. The down side of the G3 is not being able to program a path.
customer_reviews.author: OK Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it for the first time today. It does everything it said it would. This thing cleaned the pool really well and never got stuck anywhere. My pool is 18x36, 10 feet deep. I have a single speed pump, pressure is just fine. The only problem is the instructions were terrible. I called the company and they emailed me a different set and they were way better. Don't know why they don't just include that set with box.
customer_reviews.author: wendy alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great vac
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Had one for 12 years. When it finally broke I bought another. It's been at least a year now with no trouble. I would recommend this vac to anyone looking. parts such as the diaphragm are easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A.

customer_reviews.title: pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: It is really obvious of low maintenance not alot of moving or complicated parts which is one of the reasons why I chose it however it does only about 70% of pool area , the hose keeps a certain tension on it which keeps it going in a pattern over n over again then on the next day it will go another pattern, still only about 70% of surface. My hose connection is center of our 12 x 24 pool. It does pick up small leaves. The hose on all these type cleaners give it a resttiction of complete movement.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: Be careful! Don’t buy it ! just two months of using it
customer_reviews.text: only two months and already broke, the machine stopped working, the seller was contacted and did not give me any help, only call the warranty and nothing else. that vacumm is already discontinued and they sell it for an expensive price, I recommend you do not buy it, it was a bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleen02

customer_reviews.title: Very easy assembly and get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my pool and it works great. It was a very simple assembly and gets the pool very clean!
customer_reviews.author: Yad

customer_reviews.title: Best Pool Vac We've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Have had several weeks now. I must say it works very well. I had the Hayward Pro before this and this is clearly a much better and simpler cleaner. I wish I had found it sooner. Cheaper, better, and does the job. Can't ask for much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I had doubts about this because it is much less expensive than other automatic pool cleaners. I planned on giving it a try , but thought I would wind up taking it back. I was totally wrong. This works really really well. Once I got the pressure right using the flow meter, the cleaner started working exactly like it is supposed to. It definitely cleans all the way up my walls and steps and covers virtually all of my pool. I may do a little fine tuning with the weight and the hose length to optimize it, but even without any fine tuning it works better than any other cleaner I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Great
customer_reviews.text: This product was worth every penny we paid, it keeps the bottom of the pool clean and doesn't miss an area. When it goes up the wall, sometimes it gets stuck in the corners but works it's way down. We did remove the round wheel on the handle and it moves much better.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Galliani-Land

customer_reviews.title: Got stuck ALL the time
customer_reviews.text: Used for 8 months. Also bought the lead catcher recommended. I couldn’t get it to stay off of the main drain, stairs, or benches. Worked great when it was actually cleaning but it was super frustrating to have to go get it unstuck every 10 minutes. That was not what I expected. As the instructions and reviews say, I manipulated the jets MANY times to make sure the flow of the pool was proper for moving the vacuum around. My pool is a kidney shaped one so maybe it is better for a rectangular shaped pool. IDK. I finally gave up and pulled the vacuum out and have moved on.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Williams

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell you how much I hate this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my Hayward Navigator. I have had sooooooo many issues with the thing. When it worked, it was great. Then we developed a leak in the pool from the constant hammering of the pool hose - it's the way it cleans. Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Best Automatic Pool Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is our 3rd Barracuda. First one was left where we rented, the 2nd one performed well for years at our pool when we bought a home. Even our pool man says this is the best one, and we totally agree
customer_reviews.author: Suze E

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Zodiak Barracuda G3 for 8 years. I've replaced the diaphragms regularly, as is the norm. I replaced the rubber pad once. From time to time, I've had to replace a part of the tubing (the package comes with 12 sections, so extra replacement sections are provided). Although my old one is still functioning, I bought a new one, since this one is so old. I expect it will be more efficient than the 8 year old one.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Audibert

customer_reviews.title: BARACUDA G3 POOL VACUUM SWEEPER
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT pool vacuum/sweeper. I replaced my 12 year old Baracuda G3 with the same model. Very glad it was still available. Since I was already using one, it was an easy install. There were a few components such as 2 elbows and a couple other things, that the User's Manual did not describe; such as what they were for etc. Feel the manual was NOT explicit enough. Suppose I can find more info on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Cottage K

customer_reviews.title: Great little swimming pool vacuum for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 weeks now, and so far so good. I have a raised type drain, but it hasn't gotten stuck at all so far. The only down side I would give it is the connections it provides for the skimmer connection. There's plenty of attachments to connect it up, but the directions makes it way to difficult. I resorted to using only what I needed to make the connection and didn't even worry about the flow adjustment, and it worked fine. Not sure everyone will have the same luck I did, but I connect it directly with no flow control, and it works great. Beats a $400 or $600 cleaner, and cleans the pool really well.
customer_reviews.author: dssman96

customer_reviews.title: Want a Sparking Pool?
customer_reviews.text: I'm one to read reviews and saw some not so good ones, but I'm glad I made the decision to buy this. It's great! Easy to put together and get running. It's not too heavy and easy to remove from the pool and place back. It also works great when we have dust storms. No more waking up to a very dirty pool. Only one thing I kind of miss manually vacuuming. It was a great way to exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

product_meta.title: Zodiac Baracuda G3 W03000 Advanced Suction Side Automatic Pool Cleaner
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Zodiac G3 In-Ground Suction Pool Cleaner is a quiet and powerful suction cleaner that works with low-speed pumps to clean with maximum efficiency. The G3 will devour small and medium-sized debris without trouble to ensure the floor, walls and steps of your entire pool receive a thorough cleaning. 
Premium Efficiency
The Zodiac G3 is compatible with any single, two-speed or variable-speed pumps to clean more efficiently and with less flow. G3 suction cleaners work with a FlowKeeper Valve that automatically regulates water flow, to maintain peak cleaning performance even with lower horsepower pumps. Plus, Flowkeeper offers pool surface skimming with a turn of a switch Intelligent Design
Navigating an in-ground pool is made easier by the Wheel Deflector which helps with movement around tight corners. Equipped with scuff-resistant Long-Life Hoses, the G3 is a rugged pool cleaner that is eliminates scuffs on all pool surfaces. The 36-Fin Disc is cleverly designed to increase adhesion to the pool surface and avoid getting hung-up on lights, drains covers, fittings and other pool features. 
The G3 has a durable Long-Life Diaphragm with reliable, one-moving-part-technology that eliminates the need for wheels, flappers or gears to provide silent operation and low-cost maintenance. The patented Quick-Release Cassette provides easy access to the diaphragm for simplified routine maintenance.
Convenient Installation
The G3 suction cleaner works in all in-ground pools and can be installed in two simple steps:
1. Attach the disc, wheel deflector and hose 
2. Connect to the skimmer or dedicated suction line 
* No tools or special plumbing required *
feature_bullets: Quiet, powerful suction cleaner; works with low-speed pumps for maximum efficiency.
Devours small and medium-sized debris and cleans floor, walls and steps of your entire pool.
FlowKeeper Valve automatically regulates water flow to maintain peak cleaning performance even with lower horsepower pumps.
Wheel Deflector for movement around tight corners.
Scuff-resistant Long-Life Hoses eliminate scuffs on all pool surfaces.
36-Fin Disc increases adhesion to pool surface and avoids getting hung-up on lights, drains covers, fittings and other pool features.
Durable Long-Life Diaphragm with reliable, one-moving-part-technology
Patented Quick-Release Cassette provides simplified routine maintenance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,356 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
